column2: This page provides definitions for all columns included in this export. Please reach out to us at inclusivegrowthscore@mastercard.com with any questions!
column3: Unnamed: 2
Definition
Census Tract unique code
Inclusive Growth Score year of data, see methodology document for full details
Value from 1 to 9 corresponding with the USDA Rural Urban Continuum Code
State corresponding with the census tract (identifiable through first two digits of FIPS Code)
County corresponding with the census tract (identifiable through first five digits of FIPS Code)
Whether or not a census tract is a Qualified Opportunity Zone
Which geographies the ranking is relative to (USA, state, urban-rural)
Percentile rank for metric, pillar, metric type, or total
Metric value for census tract
Metric value for benchmark grouping of tracts (USA, state, urban-rural)
Average score of metrics in the place pillar representing housing, infrastructure, and built environment
Average score of metrics in the economy pillar representing business growth, jobs and spending
Average score of metrics in the community pillar representing economic and social conditions
Average score of inclusion metrics representing level of access to key resources
Average score of growth metrics representing change of community
Inclusion: Percentage of females living above the poverty line
Inclusion: Share of population under 5 years old that is enrolled in an early education program
Inclusion: Percentage of eligible population with health insurance coverage
Inclusion: Gini coefficient of income inequality (lower coefficient denotes lower inequality)
Growth: Growth of per capita income
Growth: Growth of average spend per person based on aggregated and anonymized indexed transaction data within the designated zone
Inclusion: Employment, labor force participation, and % with bachelor degree
Inclusion: Business types as percentage of total possible business types
Inclusion: Minority or women owned businesses as a percentage of all businesses
Inclusion: Growth of spending based on aggregated and anonymized indexed transaction data within the designated zone
Growth: Growth of the number of small business loans
Growth: Growth of net new businesses based on aggregated and anonymized transaction data
Inclusion: Percentage of renter and owner occupied housing units where monthly costs are lower than 30 percent of income
Inclusion: Percentage of households with an internet subscription
Inclusion: Percentage of workers with travel time to work under 35 minutes
Inclusion: Percentage of designated tract land area that is park land
Growth: Growth in the population of renter and owner occupied housing units
Growth: Growth of value of residential real estate
